questions.question: How quickly do you react to sudden changes on-screen, like spotting an enemy or dodging an attack?
answers: I react instantly without thinking, always on high alert.
I react quickly, though I take a split-second to assess.
I react slowly, focusing more on the experience than speed.
I don't rush.if I miss it, I miss it. No big deal.

questions.question: How often do you practice aiming and shooting drills (e.g., in aim trainers or warm-up sessions)?
answers: Every day.I never skip aim practice.
A few times a week, when I need a refresh.
I don't focus on drills but occasionally warm up.
I jump right into the game and go with the flow.

questions.question: How comfortable are you with quick adjustments to your aim under pressure?
answers: Completely comfortable, even in intense situations.
I can adjust well, but I take a moment if needed.
It's a challenge, but I do my best to adapt.
I play for fun, so missing shots is okay by me.

questions.question: How well do you keep track of the map layout and key locations (e.g., choke points, spawn areas)?
answers: I know every inch of the map and plan my moves.
I know most main spots, though not every detail.
I get familiar with the basics over time.
I like discovering the map naturally as I go.

questions.question: Can you predict enemy movements based on prior encounters or in-game sounds?
answers: Yes, I'm skilled at predicting and countering moves.
Sometimes I can guess, but not always perfectly.
Rarely, I mostly react to what's happening around me.
I go with the flow, no need to overthink it.

questions.question: Do you regularly use visual or audio cues to inform your decisions in-game?
answers: Yes, I rely heavily on every sound and visual cue.
I use them often, but I don't rely solely on them.
I notice some cues, but I play intuitively too.
I mostly follow the main action and don't focus on cues.

questions.question: Do you prefer to follow a plan or react spontaneously to changing in-game situations?
answers: I always have a strategy and adapt it as needed.
I like to have a plan but can adjust quickly.
I'm spontaneous and go with the flow.
I just see what happens.planning isn't my style.

questions.question: How often do you analyze your gameplay (through replays or critiques) to improve your tactics?
answers: I review my games often to improve my skills.
Sometimes, if I feel like I made mistakes.
Rarely, I mostly just try to play better each time.
I'm here to have fun, not overanalyze gameplay.

questions.question: How comfortable are you with using voice or text chat to communicate with teammates?
answers: Very comfortable; I communicate constantly.
Fairly comfortable; I talk when necessary.
I'm not big on chatting, but I listen to others.
I prefer to avoid chat and play my own way.

questions.question: Do you typically take the lead in providing information or instructions to your team?
answers: Yes, I often take charge in calling out plays.
Sometimes, when I know it's needed.
I prefer to follow and support others.
I let others handle strategy and just follow along.

questions.question: How do you handle receiving feedback or instructions from others during a match?
answers: I welcome feedback and adapt accordingly.
I'm open to it, though I decide if I use it.
I try to listen but can find it a bit annoying.
I prefer to do my own thing without feedback.

questions.question: How quickly do you adapt to new maps, weapons, or updates that change game mechanics?
answers: I adapt almost instantly, always learning fast.
I get the hang of it after a few rounds.
It takes a while for me to get used to changes.
I take my time exploring and figuring things out.

questions.question: When you encounter a challenging opponent, do you analyze and adjust your approach?
answers: Yes, I adapt my tactics to counter them.
Sometimes, I adjust my playstyle a bit.
Rarely, I usually stick to what I know best.
I keep playing my way and see what happens.

questions.question: How often do you watch tutorials, streams, or professional matches to learn new tactics?
answers: I regularly watch to improve my skills.
Occasionally, when I need specific tips.
Rarely, I just focus on playing.
I play my own way, no need for tutorials.

questions.question: How comfortable are you with controlling recoil and mastering weapon mechanics?
answers: Very comfortable; I have precise control.
Fairly comfortable, though I'm not perfect.
Not very comfortable, I struggle sometimes.
I go with the flow and enjoy experimenting.

questions.question: How frequently do you practice specific skills, like strafing, weapon-switching, or peeking?
answers: I practice daily to keep my skills sharp.
I practice sometimes, though not regularly.
Rarely, only if I feel rusty.
I don't practice. I pick it up during play.

questions.question: What is your level of experience with different weapons and their effective ranges?
answers: I know each weapon's strength and ideal range.
I know most weapons decently.
I stick to a few favorites I know well.
I pick up whatever and figure it out as I go.

questions.question: How do you manage stress and stay calm in high-stakes or fast-paced scenarios?
answers: I stay calm and keep my focus under pressure.
I manage well, though I feel some nerves.
It's challenging, but I try my best.
I let the excitement drive me, win or lose.

questions.question: How often do you play long sessions, and how do you maintain focus over time?
answers: I can play for hours with full focus.
I play long sessions but take breaks.
I tend to lose focus in extended sessions.
I play short sessions and take it easy.

questions.question: How do you handle losses, and do you feel motivated to improve after tough matches?
answers: I see losses as motivation to improve.
Sometimes, though losses can be discouraging.
I'm neutral about losses; I play to have fun.
I don't focus on winning.just on enjoying the game.
